Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: check constraint value that is used to maintain therelationship between SUPPORT FACILITY and its various sub-types.
Column Comment.1: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.2: USE IDENTIFIER: Use this primary key component to connect all the componentsthat are associated with a single use scenario. For example, if a road is used toaccess 5 wells on one surface lease and one rate schedule applies, all thesecomponents will have the same USE ID.
Column Comment.3: COMPONENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: this primary key component added toallow multiple components to be associated with a single use scenario.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area
Column Comment.6: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.7: LICENSEE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate to whom this license has been granted.
Column Comment.8: LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the approval granted to conduct activitiesor operations.
Column Comment.9: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.10: CONSENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the consent that has been obtained.
Column Comment.11: CONSULTATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this consultation as it pertains toan activity or request for an activity. Consultation discussions may occur at any pointin the life cycle of a business object.
Column Comment.12: CONTEST IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a legal dispute or contest that isassociated with this support facility.
Column Comment.13: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.14: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.16: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.17: LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this facility license.
Column Comment.18: FACILITY TYPE: A reference table identifying the codes classifying the facilityaccording to its physical equipment or principal service performed. Please note thatFACILITY_TYPE will eventually become a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30characters.
Column Comment.19: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field.
Column Comment.20: FIELD STATION ID: unique identifier for the stratigraphic field station.
Column Comment.21: AFE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the AFE or COST CENTER. Usually the AFEnumber, if natural identifiers to be used.
Column Comment.22: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.23: INFORMATION ITEM ID: The unique identifier for an information item
Column Comment.24: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.25: INSTRUMENT ID: Unique number for the legal document registered on the Cert. OfTitle indicating interest in lands e.g. charge, lien, mortgage, caveat. May be naturalKey or system assigned, based on user needs and uniqueness of natural IDs.
Column Comment.26: INTEREST SET IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the interest set.
Column Comment.27: BA INTEREST SET SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique sequencing component to allowverioning of the interest set over time.
Column Comment.28: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.29: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND UNIT, LAND UNIT TRACT, LANDAGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.30: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for the jurisdiction that is managing theland sale or bidding round.
Column Comment.31: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique identifier for the land sale.
Column Comment.32: OBLIGATION ID: Unique identifier for each obligation
Column Comment.33: OBLIGATION SEQ NO: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence of an obligation
Column Comment.34: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.35: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.36: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.37: POOL IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying the pool.
Column Comment.38: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.39: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.40: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within the schema.
Column Comment.41: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.42: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.43: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.44: WELL STRING FORMATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observationnumber used to uniquely identify each completed (perforated) formation (layer) that iscontributing production to a well string.
Column Comment.45: RATE OR FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.46: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.47: SEISMIC SET LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the approval granted toconduct seismic or geophysical operations.
Column Comment.48: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.49: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.50: SUPPORT FACILITY COMPONENT TYPE: The type of component associated witha support facility
Column Comment.51: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.52: SOURCE DOCUMENT: unique identifier for the document. For example governmentand regulatory agency forms, operator reports or scout tickets, publications,reference books etc.
Column Comment.53: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: The identifier for the application that ownsthis alias or code or that is used to apply the data in this row.
Column Comment.54: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.55: WELL LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this well license.
Column Comment.56: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.57: WELL SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a Well Set. A Well Set is a groupingmechanism for Well Components used to maintain and end to end link through allstages of the Well Life cycle (planning to disposal).
Column Comment.58: WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the work order.
Column Comment.59: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.60: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.61: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.62: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.63: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.64: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.65: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
